column4: EU lawmakers urge regulators to break up Google
column5: BRUSSELS European Union lawmakers overwhelmingly backed a motion on Thursday urging antitrust regulators to break up Google  the latest setback for the world's most popular Internet search engine.

column4: Will in-store pick-up of online sales pay off for retailers?
column5: CHICAGO  Nov 28     Brick-and-mortar merchants are seeking an edge over Amazon.com Inc and other e-tailers this holiday season by encouraging customers to pick up online orders at their local store. But the tactic could raise costs - and create problems managing inventory  retail analysts and consultants said.

column4: Blackrock cut stake in Italy's Banco Popolare to 4.9 percent: filing
column5: MILAN U.S. investment firm Blackrock  has lowered its stake in Italian cooperative bank Banco Popolare   according to a regulatory filing on Friday which showed a holding of 4.91 percent as of Nov. 21.

column4: Exclusive: KKR  Apax brace for mobile battle with EE prime target: sources
column5: LONDON Private equity funds KKR  and Apax are looking to revive plans to snap up EE if Britain's largest mobile operator misses out on a deal with BT Group   sources familiar with the situation said.

column4: Spain's Telefonica says seeks global alliance with BT
column5: MADRID  Nov 28 The chairman of Spain's Telefonica has said the company is seeking a "global alliance" with Britain's BT  with cash and shares in exchange for Telefonica unit O2  a spokesman for Telefonica confirmed on Friday.

column4: Deutsche Bank shuts down physical precious metals trading
column5: LONDON Deutsche Bank is winding down its physical precious metals trading business  it said on Thursday  moving to further scale back its exposure to commodities.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ecopetrol's Cano Limon oil pipeline in Colombia shut after attacks
column5: BOGOTA  Nov 28 Ecopetrol's Cano Limon oil pipeline in Colombia was bombed for the second time this week on Friday and will remain shut for repairs  a company official said.

column4: Ecopetrol's Cano Limon oil pipeline in Colombia shut after attack
column5: BOGOTA  Nov 28 Ecopetrol's Cano Limon oil pipeline in Colombia is shut for repairs following a bomb attack this week  and the company is investigating reports of a further attack on a stretch of the duct near the Venezuelan border  a press officer said on Friday.

column4: E.ON sells majority in U.S. wind farms to Enbridge
column5: FRANKFURT German utility E.ON  agreed to sell an 80 percent stake in two wind farms in the United States to Canada's Enbridge   as the group continues to rake in much-needed cash by building and selling pricey renewable assets.

column4: Man loses legs in Exxon Baton Rouge refinery incident: local media
column5: HOUSTON A contract worker lost his legs in an accident on Thursday at Exxon Mobil Corp's Baton Rouge  Louisiana  refinery  according to a report by WAFB-TV in Baton Rouge.

column5: NEW YORK  Nov 28 U.S. stock index futures were lower on Friday  with energy shares likely to be under heavy pressure in a holiday-shortened session as crude oil tumbled to a four-year low.

column4: Fiat Chrysler may consider loyalty share scheme in Ferrari spin-off
column5: MILAN A loyalty scheme that would increase the voting power of Ferrari shareholders is one option parent Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  (FCA) will consider when it spins off the luxury marque next year  Chairman John Elkann said on Friday.

column4: GlaxoSmithKline fires executive who raised race complaint in South Africa: Bloomberg
column5: Britain's biggest drugmaker  GlaxoSmithKline Plc  fired an executive from its South African unit for refusing to appear for a performance review  which was called a week after he complained of racial discrimination in the workplace  Bloomberg reported  citing company documents.

column4: Exclusive: P&G exploring sale of $7 billion Wella hair care unit - sources
column5: LONDON Procter & Gamble Co  is working with Goldman Sachs  to explore the sale of its Wella hair care business that could be worth around $7 billion  sources familiar with the matter told Reuters  as the world's largest consumer products company streamlines its business.

column5: TOKYO Honda Motor and Mazda Motor may have to recall another 200 000 cars in Japan to replace Takata Corp air bags if Takata complies with a U.S. order to recall cars across the United States rather than just in humid regions.

column5: CAIRO HSBC   National Bank of Egypt and National Bank of Abu Dhabi will arrange a $1.5 billion syndicated loan to Egypt's state oil company in order for the country to pay back foreign energy companies  a statement from the banks said on Friday.

column4: STXNEWS LATAM-Board of Brazil's Itaú approves new stock buyback plan
column5: The board of Itaú Unibanco Holding SA  Brazil's largest bank by market value  approved late on Thursday a revamped program to buy back as many as 10 million common shares and as many as 50 million of preferred shares. The plan will be valid for one year  the São Paulo-based bank said in a securities filing. Currently  Itaú has 261.5 million common shares and 2.69 billion preferred shares in circulation.

column4: S.Korea's Woori Bank receives lone bid in $2.7 bln stake auction -Yonhap
column5: SEOUL  Nov 28 South Korea's auction of a controlling stake in Woori Bank  the country's second-largest lender  attracted only one bid  from China's Anbang Insurance Group Co Ltd  local wire service Yonhap said on Friday.

column4: S.Korea's Kyobo Life not to bid in Woori Bank sale
column5: SEOUL  Nov 28 South Korea's Kyobo Life Insurance Co Ltd said it would not bid for a controlling stake in Woori Bank  the country's second-largest lender  abandoning an interest it had expressed in the holding put up for sale by the government.
